response_parsed.summary: This guide provides an in-depth exploration of the _locale standard library module in Python 3.12+, its key features, usage, and best practices.
key_points: _locale is a built-in module that simplifies internationalization and localization
It handles character encodings, date/time formatting, number formatting, and more across various locales
_locale uses the iconv library for character encoding conversion
New in Python 3.12: Improved Unicode support, especially for Emoji
Always ensure that you use the appropriate locale for your target audience
version_notes: Python 3.12: Improved Unicode support for Emoji
Python 3.9: Added LC_IDENTIFICATION category to get information about the current locale
caveats: Ensure that you have the necessary locale data installed on your system
Avoid hardcoding locales and use appropriate user settings when available
Use UTF-8 for character encoding whenever possible
